data.title: “RRR” Triggered My Madness and “Om Shanti Om” Sealed the Deal: Seduced By Indian Cinema

data.text:
Introduction

In 1977, Star Wars exploded onto screens and caused industry and cultural shifts like no other work of popular art before or since.

At 13 years old, I was one of the instant phenomenon’s opening-year audience members. I’ve written about this before: As the film segued to its end credits, my legs went totally numb.

Literally.

My parents and two brothers left the theater and headed to the lobby. I could not move. I was thunderstruck.

By a movie.

It happened for the first time when I was 13. Against all expectations it happened again… when I was 58.

Enter RRR and my life-changing introduction to Indian cinema.

Before we go there, however, a brief primer of Indian cinema proper, for those unfamiliar, is in order.
